description: This is not any better then GEdit. It is actually worse and has less features and plans to keep it that way.
Follows the HIG and is extremely good.
Does exactly what a simple text editor should do

This is a newer addition to the GNOME library, and it is a sleek and modern simple text editor written primarily by the author of GNOME Builder, Christian Hergert.

It has a surprising number of features, including theming, dark mode, and powerful syntax highlighting.

For folks that are saying gedit has more features: look deeper. GNOME Text Editor has a cleaner interface, so it may appear that way, but under the hood it is quite feature-filled and complex indeed. There's an art to making an advanced program like that feel and appear simple, and in that respect GNOME Text Editor succeeds with flying colours.
I just love the design change
